intro: Alyxia nathoi, commonly known as the Nathoi alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Alyxia nathoi typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in scrubland or woodland areas. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals.
